p:
We began the skin resistance analysis using all of the samples from the experimental treatments ( n = 32). We used the post trimmed and cleaned samples generated from RSEM (from above) to begin the analysis. We then removed any genes that had <10 counts across 28 samples
37 , which resulted in a total of 9346 genes for downstream analyses. Gene counts were then normalized using the varianceStabilizingTransformation function in DESeq2
75 . We ensured that the dataset did not have any missing data or zero-variance genes, and we removed one sample identified as an outlier based upon cluster analysis prior to constructing co-expression networks
37 .
